ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you changed food shopping or eating habits to save money?
Have you turned down the heat or air conditioning to save money even though it made the house uncomfortable?
Did you avoid going to see the doctor or dentist when you needed to because you had to save money?
Did you fall behind in paying bills?
Have you asked relatives or friends for money or food to help you get by?
Have you added another job to make ends meet?
Have you sold some possessions because you needed the money, even though you really wanted to keep them?
Have you moved to another house or apartment to save money?
Thinking about the past year, how difficult has it been for you to pay your family's bills each month?
How much money did you have left over after each month?
Notes: 1=More than enough; 5=Not enough to make ends meet

ElementDescription: To sum it all up, how satisfied are you with your family's total financial situation?
In the next three months, how often do you think you and your family will experience bad times, such as poor housing or not having enough food?
In the next three months, how often do you expect that you will have to do without basic things that your family needs?
